R

recieveData() - Method in class Game.Player
Receive data from the server.
The data should look like this: "[newX1,newY1]_attk#hlth ~ [newX2,newY2]_attk#hlth ~ [newX3,newY3]_attk#hlth ~ [newX4,newY4]_attk#hlth ~\n"

These numbers represent the locations of the 4 players at the given time, and the "attk" represents the Player.attackingChars field of the players.

An example input for 4 players could look like this:
[100,350]_N#2 ~ [529,350]_F#1 ~ [958,350]_N#3 ~ [1290,350]_N#1 ~\n
recieveDataFromServer(BufferedReader) - Static method in interface Game.Network
Receive data from the server.
The data should look like this: "[newX1,newY1]_attk#hlth ~ [newX2,newY2]_attk#hlth ~ [newX3,newY3]_attk#hlth ~ [newX4,newY4]_attk#hlth ~\n"

These numbers represent the locations of the 4 players at the given time, and the "attk" represents the players' attacking char.
removeSprite() - Method in class Game.FireAttack
Removes a sprite form the Sprite.existingSprites ArrayList
removeSprite() - Method in class Game.Heart
Removes a sprite form the Sprite.existingSprites ArrayList
removeSprite() - Method in class Game.Sprite
Removes a sprite form the Sprite.existingSprites ArrayList
RIGHT_HEART_INDEX - Static variable in interface Game.WorldConstants.HEARTS
 
ROWS - Static variable in class Game.FireAttack
 
ROWS - Static variable in class Game.Heart
 
ROWS - Static variable in class Game.Player
 
ROWS - Variable in class Game.Sprite
The number of rows and columns in the original sprite image (i.e the number of rows and columns in the Sprite.COSTUMES field
run() - Method in class Game.Heart
This method runs as long as the owner is not dead.
It checks the owner's health and remove the correct heart if the player has lost health from the last check
run() - Method in class Game.Main
This is the thread's function handling the cycles of the game.
In each run this method calculates the X and Y values of the player, sends them to the server, and then receives the positions of the rest of the players and updates them on the frame using the Main.updateFrame() method.
